Package com.soebes.itf.jupiter.extension

Annotation Type MavenTest

  • @Target(METHOD)
@Retention(RUNTIME)
@Documented
@Inherited
@Test
@API(status=EXPERIMENTAL,
     since="0.1.0")
public @interface MavenTest
    Author:
    Karl Heinz Marbaise

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      String[] activeProfiles
      You can define the profile you would like to activate: For example for a single profile:
      boolean debug
      This turns on -X (debug:true) for the Maven run or not (debug:false).
      String[] goals
      Defines the goals which are being executed.
      String[] options
      You can define a single option like this:
      String[] systemProperties
      By using systemProperties you can define the properties which will be given to the command line call of Maven.

    • Element Detail

      • goals

        String[] goals
        Defines the goals which are being executed. This can be used to simply override the goals given in MavenIT.goals().
        Returns:
        The default goals are none given.
        Default:
        {}

      • activeProfiles

        String[] activeProfiles
        You can define the profile you would like to activate: For example for a single profile: 
            @MavenTest(profiles = {"run-its"})
        For multiple profiles: 
            @MavenTest(profiles = {"run-its", "second-profile"})
        This is the equivalent to the command line like: -Prun-its,second-profile
        Returns:
        The defines profiles.
        Default:
        {}

      • options

        String[] options
        You can define a single option like this: 
            @MavenTest(options = {"-o"})
        This is the equivalent to the command line like: -o.

        You can of course combine several options like the following: 

            @MavenTest(options = {"-X", "-o"})
        This is the equivalent to the command line like: -X -o

        You can make your options a little bit more readable by using MavenOptions like the following: 

            @MavenTest(options = {MavenOptions.DEBUG, "-o"})
        Returns:
        The defined options.
        See Also:
        MavenOptions
        Default:
        {}

      • systemProperties

        String[] systemProperties
        By using systemProperties you can define the properties which will be given to the command line call of Maven. 
            @MavenTest(options = {systemProperteis {
      "remotePom=localhost:dummy-bom-pom:1.0",
      "reportOutputFile=target/depDiffs.txt"
    })
        This will be the equivalent of giving the properties via command line like this: 
           mvn -DremotePom=localhost:dummy-bom-pom:1.0 -DreportOutputFile=target/depDiffs.txt ...
        Returns:
        The defines system properties.
        Default:
        {}

      • debug

        boolean debug
        This turns on -X (debug:true) for the Maven run or not (debug:false).
        Returns:
        Debug
        Default:
        false
